questions.questionText: A large bag contains 10 books. 7 are red and 3 are pink. If 2 books are selected at random from the sample, one at a time without replacement, what is the probability that both books are not pink?
questions.hint: Compound Probability (of 2 or more things happening simultaneously) is the product of the individual probabilities. Example: the probability of event a AND b happening = the probability of event a x the probability of event b.

questions.questionText: Kyle played 5 games of basketball and had a mean score of 73. Norene played 2 games and had a mean score of 97. What was the mean of the scores for all 7 of these games?
questions.hint: A mean score of 73 for 5 games is the same as saying...The total score for all 5 games is (73 x 5) = 365.
